intro: Aspidogyne alajuelae, commonly known as the Alajuela spurge, is a flowering plant native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
